abstract: A group of banks led by Wells Fargo said Friday that it opposed a $119 million bid by the British private equity firm Emerisque Brands for the bankrupt men’s clothier Hartmarx, saying the offer failed to provide adequate value to Hartmarx’s lenders.
snippet: A group of banks led by Wells Fargo said Friday that it opposed a $119 million bid by the British private equity firm Emerisque Brands for the bankrupt men’s clothier Hartmarx, saying the offer failed to provide adequate value to Hartmarx’s lender...
lead_paragraph: Update | 7:12 p.m. The New York Times’s Steven Greenhouse has more detail on Wells Fargo’s objections to the Hartmarx deal in this article.
